t: Proverbs 1
The Beginning of Knowledge
The*pn proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
To*ln know wisdom and instruction, To*ld perceive the words of understanding,
To*ld receive the instruction of wisdom, Justice,*ld judgment, and equity;
To*ld give prudence to the simple, To*ld the young man knowledge and discretion—
A*ld wise man*i will hear and increase learning, And*ld a man of understanding will attain wise counsel,
To*ld understand a proverb and an enigma, The*ld words of the wise and their riddles.
The*ld fear of the Lord*s is*i the beginning of knowledge, But*ild fools despise wisdom and instruction.
Shun Evil Counsel
My*pn son, hear the instruction of your father, And*ld do not forsake the law of your mother;
For*ld they will*i be*i a graceful ornament on your head, And*ld chains about your neck.
My*ln son, if sinners entice you, Do*ld not consent.
If*ld they say, “Come with us, Let*ld us lie in wait to shed*i blood; Let*ld us lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;
Let*ld us swallow them alive like Sheol, And*ld whole, like those who go down to the Pit;
We*ld shall find all kinds*i of precious possessions, We*ld shall fill our houses with spoil;
Cast*ld in your lot among us, Let*ld us all have one purse”—
My*ld son, do not walk in the way with them, Keep*ld your foot from their path;
For*ld their feet run to evil, And*ld they make haste to shed blood.
Surely,*ld in vain the net is spread In*ld the sight of any bird;
But*ld they lie in wait for their own*i blood, They*ld lurk secretly for their own*i lives.
So*ld are*i the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain; It*ld takes away the life of its owners.
The Call of Wisdom
Wisdom*pn calls aloud outside; She*ld raises her voice in the open squares.
She*ld cries out in the chief concourses, At*ld the openings of the gates in the city She*ld speaks her words:
“How*ld long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity? For*ld scorners delight in their scorning, And*ld fools hate knowledge.
Turn*ld at my rebuke; Surely*ld I will pour out my spirit on you; I*ld will make my words known to you.
Because*ld I have called and you refused, I*ld have stretched out my hand and no one regarded,
Because*ld you disdained all my counsel, And*ld would have none of my rebuke,
I*ld also will laugh at your calamity; I*ld will mock when your terror comes,
When*ld your terror comes like a storm, And*ld your destruction comes like a whirlwind, When*ld distress and anguish come upon you.
“Then*ln they will call on me, but I will not answer; They*ld will seek me diligently, but they will not find me.
Because*ld they hated knowledge And*ld did not choose the fear of the Lord,*s
They*ld would have none of my counsel And*ild despised my every rebuke.
Therefore*ld they shall eat the fruit of their own way, And*ld be filled to the full with their own fancies.
For*ld the turning away of the simple will slay them, And*ld the complacency of fools will destroy them;
But*ld whoever listens to me will dwell safely, And*ld will be secure, without fear of evil.”
